title: For India, China is main rival & Pakistan an ancillary security issue: US intel
content: The US Defence Intelligence Agency reports Pakistan views India as an "existential threat," modernizing its military and tactical nuclear weapons to counter India's conventional advantage. India considers China its primary adversary, managing Pakistan as a secondary concern despite recent border skirmishes.

title: US arrests man accused of firebomb plot against Embassy in Israel
content: Joseph Neumeyer, a dual citizen, was arrested in New York after being deported from Israel for allegedly attempting to firebomb the US Embassy in Tel Aviv. He is accused of using Molotov cocktails and making violent online threats against Americans and Donald Trump. The arrest follows the killing of two Israeli Embassy staffers in Washington, D.C.

title: Mumbai could see earliest ever monsoon arrival: IMD
content: Mumbai is bracing for a potentially record-breaking early monsoon, with the IMD forecasting onset within three days, possibly surpassing the 1956 record of May 29. The southwest monsoon has already reached Devgad, Konkan, ten days ahead of schedule. Favorable conditions suggest further advancement across Maharashtra, including Mumbai.

title: Watch: DC drop 'movie teaser' after Faf & Preity Zinta's pic goes viral
content: Delhi Capitals concluded their IPL 2025 season with a six-wicket victory over Punjab Kings. However, a viral moment between Faf du Plessis and Preity Zinta stole the spotlight. A fan's suggestion of casting them in a movie sparked a playful response from Faf and a heartwarming video from Delhi Capitals.

title: Centre seeks to ensure FDI inflow remains strong
content: The Indian government is actively working to maintain strong FDI inflows by streamlining regulations and offering tailored investment packages to global corporations. Efforts include easing regulatory frameworks at the state level, simplifying sectoral FDI regulations, and addressing investor concerns regarding land availability.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: 'Attitude shouldn't change with price tag': Rahane on Venkatesh Iyer
content: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Ajinkya Rahane addressed the team's underwhelming IPL 2025 campaign, highlighting inconsistent batting. He defended Venkatesh Iyer amid scrutiny over his Rs 23.75 crore price tag. While KKR’s bowlers impressed, Rahane admitted the batting unit faltered under pressure.

title: Court allows NIA to take custody of CRPF jawan in espionage case
content: A Delhi court has granted the National Investigation Agency (NIA) 15-day custody of a CRPF jawan arrested for espionage. The jawan is accused of leaking sensitive information to Pakistani intelligence officers in exchange for money.

title: SRH head coach breaks silence on Shami's struggles in IPL 2025
content: SRH head coach Daniel Vettori addressed Mohammed Shami's inconsistent IPL 2025 performance, attributing it to a long T20 layoff. Shami, a 2023 Purple Cap winner, struggled with lengths this season, taking six wickets in nine games at an economy of 11.23. Vettori also clarified that Nitish Kumar Reddy's limited bowling was due to a pre-tournament side strain, which impacted his all-round contribution despite being a breakout star last season.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO’s speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: DGCA gives nod to arts & commerce students becoming commercial pilots in India
content: In a significant reform, the DGCA has recommended allowing arts and commerce students to pursue commercial pilot licenses, ending the three-decade-long requirement for science backgrounds. This proposal, sent to the aviation ministry, aims to amend rules mandating physics and maths in class 12.

title: Chhattisgarh cops not keen to give Basavaraju's body to family
content: Chhattisgarh Police is hesitant to release the body of slain Maoist leader Basavaraju to his family, fearing a public funeral could glorify his violent past. While relatives in Andhra Pradesh seek the body for last rites, authorities are wary of potential exploitation by Maoists to ignite public sympathy.

title: Pak’s defence budget hike sparks fiscal priorities debate amid cash crunch
content: Pakistan's 18% defence budget increase to over Rs 2.5 lakh crore amid economic struggles and tensions with India raises concerns about fiscal priorities. Economists fear this move, coupled with costly projects like the Diamer-Bhasha Dam, could jeopardize economic reforms and social spending, especially with a high debt-to-GDP ratio and IMF pressures.

title: LinkedIn co-founder: Startup founders talking about work-life balance are not …
content: Reid Hoffman, LinkedIn's co-founder, has sparked controversy by asserting that startup founders prioritizing work-life balance lack the dedication needed for success. He defended his stance, stating that achieving significant startup growth demands intense focus and a temporary sacrifice of personal time.

title: Gang-raped & tortured, 45-year-old tribal woman bleeds to death in MP
content: In a village near Indore, a 45-year-old tribal woman died after a brutal gangrape and assault. She was found unconscious with severe internal injuries after returning from a wedding with Hari Palvi, who, along with Sunil Korku, is now arrested. The woman reportedly identified her attackers before succumbing to her injuries, which included fatal damage from a sharp object.

title: ‘Bhool Chuk Maaf’: Rajkummar Rao-Wamiqa Gabbi starrer inches towards Rs.30 cr
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf,' a comedy-drama set against wedding festivities, has garnered significant attention. Despite initial release challenges, the film opened strong, earning Rs. 7 crore on Friday and witnessing substantial growth over the weekend. The movie has collected Rs. 27.75 crore in its first three days and is expected to cross Rs. 30 crore if it maintains its momentum.

title: Brett Favre claims Netflix is smearing him overTrump support, not scandals
content: NFL Hall of Famer Brett Favre is embroiled in controversy following Netflix's 'Untold: The Fall of Favre,' which revisits scandals including a Mississippi welfare fraud case and sexual harassment allegations. Favre suggests the documentary is politically motivated due to his support for Donald Trump, amplifying accusations of bias against Netflix.

title: New Covid variant sparks concern: Here's what early symptoms look like
content: A new Covid-19 variant, NB.1.8.1, has surfaced in the US, following a surge in China, with cases detected in international travelers and spreading locally. While it may be more transmissible, the WHO states there's no evidence of increased severity. Symptoms include low-grade hyperthermia, respiratory issues, and gastrointestinal distress.

title: Virat Kohli to Zaheer on son Fatehsinh: 'His eyes are just like you'
content: Virat Kohli and Zaheer Khan shared a wholesome moment ahead of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) clash, delighting fans across social media. In a video shared by LSG, Virat is seen looking at pictures of Zaheer’s newborn son, and his adorable observation quickly won hearts online.

title: India’s Shubhanshu Shukla enters quarantine ahead of Ax-4 space launch
content: Indian astronaut-designate Shubhanshu Shukla and his three crewmates are entering quarantine as preparations intensify for the Axiom Mission-4 (Ax-4) launch, scheduled for June 8. A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket will carry the crew to the International Space Station for a 14-day mission focused on science, outreach, and commercial activities.

title: 'Lost' grasshopper species rediscovered in the wild after 43 years
content: After being declared extinct in 1996, the Monte Gordo grasshopper has been rediscovered in Cape Verde's highlands. Dutch biologists spotted the insect during a field trip, finding multiple specimens within Monte Gordo Natural Park. This 'living fossil,' uniquely adapted to the harsh environment, now faces a 'Vulnerable' status due to its tiny territory and habitat risks.

title: In Chambal, ex-dacoits' wives turn water warriors to battle drought
content: In Rajasthan's Karauli, women have spearheaded a remarkable transformation, combating drought and dacoity. Facing declining rainfall and barren lands, they convinced their husbands to abandon crime and revive traditional water bodies. Through community efforts and the support of Tarun Bharat Sangh, they built ponds, revitalized the Serni river, and brought prosperity back to the region, fostering stability and hope.

title: Stir against 'Manipur' being erased from bus turns violent
content: Protests erupted in Imphal after a 48-hour ultimatum for Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla to apologize for the removal of "Manipur" from a state transport bus windshield expired, leading to clashes with security forces near Raj Bhavan. Police used tear gas to disperse protesters, resulting in injuries and hospitalizations.

title: Illegal sand mining alters Yamuna course in Haryana
content: Haryana's irrigation department has reported extensive illegal sand mining in Sonipat's Asadpur village, leading to the Yamuna river's course alteration. Violations of environmental laws and NGT directives were observed, with licensed operators exceeding permitted zones using heavy machinery.

title: 18 BJP MLAs back in Karnataka House as suspension lifted
content: Karnataka Assembly Speaker UT Khader has revoked the suspension of 18 BJP MLAs, allowing them to attend the upcoming monsoon session in July. The MLAs were initially suspended for six months due to unruly behavior during the budget session.

title: Kerala oil spill sparks fears of threat to marine species
content: The sinking of the MSC ELSA 3 container ship off Kochi poses a significant ecological threat to marine and coastal ecosystems, particularly fisheries. Experts warn that leakage of hazardous cargo like calcium carbide and oil could smother sensitive marine species and disrupt fishing activities, especially during the crucial monsoon breeding season.

title: Avoid speaking out of turn, PM warns netas at NDA meet
content: Prime Minister Modi asserted that caste enumeration aims to integrate marginalized communities into the development mainstream, clarifying that the NDA government prioritizes empowerment over caste-based politics. The NDA lauded the caste census initiative, emphasizing its necessity for societal inclusion.

title: Pension isn't charity but a legal right, shouldn't be delayed even by a day: HC
content: Calcutta High Court has firmly stated that pension is a legal entitlement, not charity, rebuking Hooghly Chinsurah municipality for delaying pension payments to 148 retired Group D workers, citing technological issues. The court emphasized that delaying pension, earned through years of service, causes undue hardship and violates principles of equity and justice.

title: Tej Pratap: Rebel without cause, felled by poll cause
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, Lalu Prasad's elder son, has become a political liability for the RJD. His erratic behavior and public personal dramas, including a tumultuous marriage and divorce, have overshadowed party agendas.

title: Lavrov may visit India in June ahead of Vladimir Putin's trip
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov is slated to visit India next month, paving the way for President Vladimir Putin's anticipated trip later this year for the annual India-Russia summit. Discussions will likely encompass defense, energy security, and boosting bilateral trade to $100 billion by 2030 using national currencies. NSA Ajit Doval will also attend a security meeting in Moscow.

title: UP woman mauled to death by leopard while trying to save kid
content: In a tragic incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, a 38-year-old woman was fatally attacked by a leopard while protecting her daughter. The incident occurred in Ayodhyapurwa village, where Zarina Bano confronted the leopard as it threatened her daughter. Despite her bravery, she was dragged away and killed.

title: Monsoon arrives in Goa, earliest in 20 years
content: The southwest monsoon made an early arrival in Goa on Sunday, May 26th, marking the earliest onset in 20 years, according to the IMD. Goa has already experienced significant pre-monsoon rainfall, the third highest in 64 years. An orange alert has been issued, forecasting heavy to very heavy rainfall and strong winds in the coming days.

title: Two accused in 2003 Kolkata gang-rape case acquitted 20 years later
content: In a Kolkata gang-rape case from May 2003, which went to trial in January 2025, two accused individuals were acquitted due to a lack of evidence and the complainant's inability to recall the incident after two decades.

title: CBI arrests wanted suspect Chandok upon arrival from US
content: Angad Singh Chandok, an alleged economic offender, was apprehended by the CBI at Delhi airport following his deportation from the US. He faced charges in both countries and was taken into custody upon arrival.

title: 7 UP officers injured in attack by bees
content: A swarm of bees severely injured at least seven government officers during an inspection of the Har Ghar Nal Yojana in Devgarh village, Uttar Pradesh. Additional District Magistrate Rajesh Srivastava, who sustained over 500 stings, is in critical condition. Other officials, including the Chief Development Officer, were also badly injured, requiring hospitalization.

title: Premier League final day drama: Results, full scorelines and final standings
content: Liverpool clinched the Premier League title with 84 points after a thrilling final day. Arsenal secured second place with 74 points, followed by Manchester City in third with 71. Chelsea's late surge earned them fourth place with 69 points, while Newcastle finished fifth with 66.

title: J&K LG Sinha warns ‘terrorist state’ Pakistan against misadventure
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha issued a stern warning to Pakistan, stating that any future misadventures would result in the destruction of the "terrorist state" by Indian armed forces. He highlighted the bravery displayed during "Operation Sindoor" following the Pahalgam terror attack and vowed to eliminate terrorism from J&K, ensuring equal punishment for terrorists and their supporters.

title: Omar’s party goes unrepresented as party MP opts out of outreach trip
content: J&K National Conference will not nominate a replacement for MP Mian Altaf Ahmad in the all-party delegations briefing foreign nations about India’s anti-terrorism stance, after Altaf declined due to religious commitments. This decision means NC will have no political representation in any of the seven delegations.

title: Wife of victim among three held for 'blind murder' in J&K’s Udhampur district
content: Jammu & Kashmir police have solved a murder case in Udhampur district, arresting three individuals, including the victim's wife. The investigation began after a decomposed body was discovered in a bag near Laddha village. Authorities identified the deceased as Ravi Kumar, and the suspects confessed to the crime, attributing it to a domestic dispute; the murder weapon has been recovered.

title: Vikings ignore Rodgers rumors as J J McCarthy takes spotlight
content: Despite rumors of Aaron Rodgers' interest, the Minnesota Vikings are fully backing their young quarterback, J.J. McCarthy. After missing last season due to injury, McCarthy is now healthy and ready to lead the team. The Vikings believe in his potential and have surrounded him with talent, hoping he will prove to be their quarterback of the future.

title: Art project or UFO? Scientists torn over 'mysterious sphere' found in Colombia
content: A mysterious metallic sphere discovered in Colombia has sparked debate, with some speculating about extraterrestrial origins due to its seamless construction. Researchers are studying the object, while others suggest it could be an art installation.

title: Heavy rains makes May Delhi’s wettest ever on record
content: Delhi experienced its wettest May since 1901, with 186.4 mm of rainfall, surpassing the 2008 record. A heavy downpour on Sunday, totaling 81.4 mm with winds up to 82 kmph, caused waterlogging and disrupted flights. The temperature at Safdarjung observatory dropped dramatically, and the IMD forecasts more light rain and thunderstorms this week.

title: 'Pak on notice': J&K LG Sinha on consequences for 'future misadventure'
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha issued a strong warning to Pakistan, stating that any future aggression would be met with decisive action by Indian forces. Speaking at the All J-K Jat Sabha, he assured that terrorists and their supporters would face equal consequences.

title: Liberian cargo ship sinks: Kerala on alert over possible oil spill — Top developments
content: A statewide emergency has been declared in Kerala after the MSC ELSA 3, a container ship carrying hazardous cargo, capsized off the coast. All crew members were rescued, but a significant oil leak poses a threat to the sensitive coastline.

title: Big reveal: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt is dating ex-QB Trent Green’s son
content: Gracie Hunt, daughter of Kansas City Chiefs owner Clark Hunt, reveals her mystery man. She is dating Derek Green, son of former Chiefs quarterback Trent Green. The couple met seven and a half years ago. Gracie shared snapshots of their blossoming relationship on Instagram. The photos show them enjoying time together.

title: Rafael Nadal footprint etched forever at Roland Garros - Watch
content: Rafael Nadal, the 'King of Clay,' received a heartfelt farewell at Roland Garros, marking his retirement with a special ceremony. The emotional event celebrated his record-breaking 14 French Open titles and remarkable career. Rivals Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, and Andy Murray joined in the tribute, acknowledging their shared history and mutual respect after years of intense competition on the court.

title: Trump’s ‘big beautiful bill’ faces Senate hurdles as GOP senators raise red flags
content: President Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill Act faces significant hurdles in the Senate after a narrow House passage. Republican Senators like Ron Johnson and Rand Paul express concerns over the bill's impact on the deficit and debt ceiling. Moderate senators also question proposed Medicaid reforms, making the bill's future uncertain despite Trump's desire for quick enactment.

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat calls for Hindus to unify to make Bharat mighty
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stressed the importance of unifying Hindu society and transforming India into a powerful military and economic force to defend against external threats. He highlighted that strength combined with righteousness is essential for national security and global influence.

title: ‘Children are unique, not copies of their parents’
content: Panellists highlighted the importance of prioritising nutrition, monitoring growth and milestones, and positive parenting skills at The Hindu’s webinar on ‘How to raise a healthy child’ in collaboration with Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore

title: CDS Gen. Chauhan conducts 'strategic review' at Army's northern, western commands
content: In separate visits to the two crucial commands that played a major role during Operation Sindoor, Gen. Chauhan commended the overall synergy and timely accomplishment of tasks under challenging conditions

title: Tamil Nadu government forms city-level authority for urban disaster management
content: The authority will be responsible for the preparation and implementation of disaster management plans approved by the State authority

title: Union govt. seeks opinion of States on implications of SC order on domicile quota in PG medical courses
content: Currently, 50% of the PG medical seats are allocated by the National Testing Agency under the all-India quota seats. The remaining 50% of the seats are given to the states.

title: ‘Headline’ schemes, but T.N.’s women deserve better
content: A number of women-centric schemes have been launched but women in the State face ‘spectacle over substance’

title: M.P. man in viral obscene video Manoharlal Dhakad arrested
content: Mandsaur SP Abhishek Anand told The Hindu that a video had gone viral on May 13 which was taken into cognisance and an FIR was lodged in Bhanpura police station

title: Government to unveil Bharat Forecasting System on May 26
content: BFS provides insight into weather events likely to take place in a grid of 6 km by 6 km against the earlier models that gave predictions for a 12 km grid, said M. Ravichandran, Secretary, Ministry of Earth Sciences. Powered by new supercomputer Arka, it will be able to provide more accurate and localised predictions

title: Provide detailed information to staff on Unified Pension Scheme, directs Railways Ministry
content: ‘It is essential that employees are well-informed and supported in making their decisions,’ the Ministry said

title: Naidu, Pawan laud Modi on India overtaking Japan to become world’s fourth largest economy
content: In their messages on X, they extol the Prime Minister’s visionary leadership, and call it a step towards achieving Viksit Bharat-2047

title: Cryptic tweets by J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, National Conference MP Ruhullah hint at friction within party
content: These tweets assumed significance as Mr. Ruhullah reportedly expressed a dissenting voice during a meeting of the ruling NC on May 21, where it passed a seven-point resolution in favour of special status and restoration of Statehood.

title: Assam CM reminds Dhaka of two Bangladesh ‘chicken necks’
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s comment is seen as a reaction to the Bangladesh interim government’s recent views on the northeastern part of India

title: Insecurity making Assam CM attack Gaurav Gogoi: Congress
content: Congress leader Ripun Bora says Himanta Biswa Sarma fears losing the 2026 Assembly election if the Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha is projected as the probable Chief Minister

title: Former Andhra Pradesh Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy arrested in mining scam
content: The YSRCP leader, who has been on the run for the last two months, has been taken into custody in Karnataka

title: PM Modi to launch projects worth over ₹ 77,000 crore in Gujarat
content: PM Modi will inaugurate a locomotive manufacturing plant and flag off an electric locomotive from Dahod on Monday

title: Tribal woman dies in Madhya Pradesh after being gang-raped
content: The police have arrested the two accused in connection with the incident that occurred on May 24 in Khalwa tehsil, about 90 km from the district headquarters

title: Net FDI decline reflects investment uncertainty in India: Jairam Ramesh
content: The uncertainty is deterring not only foreign investors but Indian companies too, the Congress leader says, quoting RBI data

title: Three held for attacking four persons over suspicion of moving beef in U.P.
content: Two first information reports (FIR) have been registered over the issue. Special police teams have been formed to identify and arrest other attackers, and the police are waiting for a lab test report on the meat to proceed further in the case.

title: 24 families evacuated after pillar at apartment complex in Kochi suffers damage
content: Ernakulam MP calls for a team of experts from PWD Buildings wing, Kochi Corporation, and disaster management to assess the damage

title: India, Maldives to review implementation of economic, maritime security partnership
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and his Maldivian counterpart Abdulla Khaleel would hold talks on the India-Maldives economic and maritime security partnership, strengthening ties after previous strains

title: Need to go full throttle on indigenous defence systems: DRDO ex-chief Satheesh Reddy
content: Operation Sindoor has showcased India’s capability, and this will lead to a rise in defence exports, says Dr. Reddy; the industry must gear up and be ready to absorb bulk orders, he says

title: India views China as ‘primary adversary’, Pakistan more an ‘ancillary’ security problem: U.S. report
content: “Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s defence priorities will probably focus on demonstrating global leadership, countering China, and enhancing New Delhi’s military power,” says the U.S. Defence Intelligence Agency

title: Dilute Kavitha’s discourse by focussing on people’s issues, KCR apparently tells KTR
content: KCR is reported to have asked KTR to focus on the party affairs and also ask other leaders not to respond unnecessarily

title: 2,260 special educator posts to be filled; recruitment notification awaited
content: There are 41,119 children with special needs categorised under nine different disabilities in government and government-aided schools in the State;

title: Thrissur gears up for monsoon, directive to follow dam rule curves to mitigate flood risks
content: Collector asks officials to assess potential rise in river levels and the impact on surrounding areas before releasing water from dams

title: Govt. doctors’ association condemns comments made by Perni Nani against GGH Superintendent
content: The former Minister had alleged that the hospital management did not treat former Gannavaram MLA Vallabhaneni Vamsi, who was brought to the GGH on Saturday for breathing problems, properly

title: Holiday declared for educational institutions in Ernakulam on May 26
content: The Collector has urged residents in houses vulnerable to heavy winds and roof damage to take necessary precautions or move to safer locations

title: A.P. police to hold survey of migrant workers
content: Over 5 lakh workers from other States are engaged in aqua, catering, hotels and other sectors in Andhra Pradesh

title: Akali Dal councillor shot dead in Amritsar
content: Councillor Harjinder Singh shot dead in Jandiala; Akali Dal leader blames police and AAP government for negligence.

title: Ahead of two crucial polls, LDF and UDF face a ballot box test in Nilambur
content: BJP seems undecided about contesting the byelection. P.V. Anvar, whose resignation as LDF-backed Independent MLA necessitated the bypoll, makes clear his support for the UDF

title: Downpour impacts life in Malnad region; auto driver dies after tree falls on vehicle
content: The crest gates of Tunga dam at Gajanur opened to release excess water. The officers of Yagachi dam in Belur have appealed to the people in the downstream to move to safer places as water could be released anytime

title: Heavy rain wreaks havoc in Ernakulam; red alert issued
content: IMD forecasts downpour in Ernakulam over the next few days, with extremely heavy rain expected on May 26; trees uprooted, houses damaged; coastal villages brace for flooding as residents fear incessant rainfall could lead to serious problems; water levels at Periyar river basin monitoring points remain below flood warning levels

title: Vellingiri Hills closed to visitors in view of weather alert; two pilgrims die of suspected health issues
content: Pilgrims, who already started trekking and those who reached the summit, were asked to descend immediately

title: Illegal tractors wreak havoc on Bengaluru roads; pose safety and environmental threat
content: Across Bengaluru, these tractors are increasingly used to transport construction and demolition waste, illegally

title: Boy from Kerala killed in the Nilgiris as heavy rain lashes the Western Ghats
content: The victim, identified as P. Adhidev of Kozhikode, was at Eighth Mile, a popular picnicking spot for tourists, when a tree fell on him.

title: Sister Anupama, who braved attacks to lead protests against Bishop Franco, leaves congregation
content: She had emerged as the public face of the protest seeking justice for the nun who alleged she was raped by the Bishop

title: Harish flays Congress, BJP silence on AP’s Banakacharla project
content: Harish Rao asks Chandrababu Naidu why he had opposed Kaleshwaram, Sita Rama projects when there’s so much of surplus water as being claimed by AP Govt.

title: BRS in turmoil, but Congress is strong: Jagga Reddy
content: Jagga Reddy accused the BJP of nurturing discontent in the BRS to gain political ground in the state, despite lacking a significant presence.

title: U.S. wins 1st worlds in 92 years, honors Gaudreau
content: Buffalo Sabres forward Tage Thompson scored 2:02 into overtime, and Team USA outlasted Switzerland 1-0 in the final of the ice hockey world championship Sunday, the first American title in this tournament in 92 years after winning it in 1933.

title: 3-time IndyCar champ Palou wins 1st Indy 500
content: Alex Palou on Sunday became the first driver from Spain to win the Indianapolis 500, holding off former Chip Ganassi Racing teammate Marcus Ericsson over the closing laps.

title: Double trouble: Larson crashes at Indy, on to 600
content: Kyle Larson crashed out of the Indianapolis 500 on Lap 92 and has arrived in Charlotte, where he will look to refocus for NASCAR's Coca-Cola 600.

title: Cruz crushes 122.9 mph HR, breaking own mark
content: The Pirates' Oneil Cruz had the hardest-hit ball since Statcast started tracking in 2015, a home run that left the bat at 122.9 mph and splashed into the Allegheny River.

title: SEC awarded half of NCAA baseball regional sites
content: SEC schools were awarded eight of the 16 regional sites for the NCAA baseball tournament on Sunday, tying the record it set in 2023.

title: 'Focus remains us': Storm win, spoil Loyd return
content: Jewell Loyd came out hot in her return on to Seattle's Climate Pledge Arena for the first time since requesting a trade that sent her to the Las Vegas Aces on Sunday, but the remaining members of the Storm stole the show in an impressive 102-82 victory.

title: Skinner 'felt really good' in Oilers' Game 3 win
content: The Edmonton Oilers made the most of home ice at Rogers Place Sunday afternoon, taking a 2-1 series lead in their Western Conference final series with the Dallas Stars by posting a 6-1 victory that included 33 saves from veteran goaltender Stuart Skinner.

title: UNC caps unbeaten season with women's lax title
content: North Carolina capped an unbeaten season with a 12-8 win over Northwestern on Sunday for the program's fourth NCAA women's lacrosse championship.

title: 'We really left our mark': Jewell Loyd reflects on return to Seattle
content: Despite an offseason trade to the Aces, Jewell Loyd returns to Seattle with fond memories on and off the court.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Maiden Indy 500 win completes Palou's domination of IndyCar
content: After three titles and 15 wins, Álex Palou felt incomplete. Now an Indy 500 winner, that's no longer the case.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the French Open?
content: The French Open begins Sunday, with plenty of intrigue. Who will take the titles? Our experts make predictions.

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Premier League final day: UCL for Chelsea, Man City; Man United deny Villa
content: On the final day of the Premier League season, Chelsea confirmed their place in the Champions League, while Aston Villa left Old Trafford disappointed.

title: Aston Villa file complaint after costly ref 'mistake'
content: Aston Villa confirmed they have made a complaint to the PGMOL about the selection of "inexperienced" referee Thomas Bramall after a costly decision to rule out a Morgan Rogers goal.

title: Pep hints at Grealish exit after squad omission
content: Guardiola has suggested that Grealish may have to leave City after the forward was omitted from the squad for the 2-0 win over Fulham.

title: Tearful TAA on Liverpool fans: 'Never felt so loved'
content: An emotional Trent Alexander-Arnold said that he had "never felt so loved and so cared for than today" as he celebrated Liverpool's Premier League title.

title: Amorim says sorry as Utd cap worst Prem season
content: Ruben Amorim made a public apology to Manchester United's supporters and then urged them to "stick together" after the club's worst-ever Premier League season.

title: City, Chelsea, Newcastle make UCL; Villa miss out
content: On a dramatic final day of the Premier League, Manchester City, Chelsea and Newcastle United secured their spots in next season's Champions League.

title: Salah wins Golden Boot in record-setting season
content: Mohamed Salah capped off an incredible season for Liverpool by winning the Premier League Golden Boot and Playmaker of the Season awards.

title: Maresca gives profane retort to Chelsea's critics
content: Enzo Maresca told Chelsea's critics to "f-off" after beating Nottingham Forest on the final day to secure Champions League qualification.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make £67m move for Benjamin Sesko
content: Is Benjamin Sesko the man to solve Arsenal's striking woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Karnataka Assembly Speaker Revokes Suspension Of 18 BJP Legislators
content: More than two months after 18 BJP MLAs were suspended from the Karnataka Legislative Assembly for six months, Speaker U T Khader on Sunday said their suspension has been revoked.

title: Chief Of Defence Staff's 'Strategic Review' Of Army's Combat Readiness
content: Chief of Defence Staff Gen Anil Chauhan on Sunday carried out a strategic review of the Indian Army's combat readiness at the force's northern and western theatres following the Operation Sindoor.

title: BJP Notice To UP Leader Over His Viral Video With Woman At Party Office
content: An Uttar Pradesh BJP leader has sent a notice by the party to explain his "inappropriate" video with a woman at the district party office in Gonda, which is nearly 120 km from the state capital Lucknow.

title: Assam Minister Hands Over Compensation To Families Of 2 Pahalgam Attack Victims In Karnataka
content: The Assam government continued to hand over financial assistance to the kin of the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack, with state minister Bimal Borah visiting the residences of two bereaved families in Karnataka on Sunday.

title: Gang-Raped, Tortured, Tribal Woman Bled To Death In Madhya Pradesh
content: A woman was raped and tortured and left to die in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh. She died before the police reached the spot. The gruesome rape-murder took place around 1 pm on Saturday in the Roshni Chowki area under the tribal zone Khalwa.

title: BJP MP Apologises For 'Women In Pahalgam' Remark, Says It Was "Distorted"
content: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra on Sunday claimed his remarks on the Pahalgam terror victims were "distorted" for political motives, and he had no intention of insulting anyone, as the opposition parties demanded his sacking.

title: PM's Advice At Key Meet After BJP Leaders' Controversial Op Sindoor Remarks
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has sounded a warning to the leaders of his party who made several injudicious remarks on Operation Sindoor - India's precision strikes on the terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir - sources have said.

title: French Mountaineer Benjamin Vedrines Sets New Mont Blanc Speed Climb Record
content: Rising French mountaineering star Benjamin Vedrines broke the record for the fastest ascent and descent of western Europe's highest mountain Mont Blanc, beating a mark that had stood for over a decade, his team said Sunday.

title: 31, Including Chinese Woman, Arrested For Drug Use At Bengaluru Party: Cops
content: Thirty-one individuals were arrested here during a birthday party for possessing and using narcotic substances, police said on Sunday. Among them were seven women, including a Chinese national.

title: Delhi Logs Wettest May On Record As Rain Lashes City, Cause Major Disruptions
content: With a thunderstorm battering the city in the early hours of Sunday and dumping 81.4 mm of rain in just a few hours, Delhi recorded its wettest May since record-keeping began in 1901, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: Girl, 15, Raped Repeatedly, Forced Into Prostitution In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A 15-year-old girl was confined in a house for two months, repeatedly raped, forced to undergo an abortion and was also made to indulge in prostitution by a man known to her family in Dombivali in Maharashtra's Thane district, a police official said.

title: After Waterlogging In Delhi, AAP Asks Where Is Minister, BJP Says...
content: The Aam Aadmi Party on Sunday lambasted the BJP-led dispensation over waterlogging in Delhi, calling it a failure of the "four-engine" government.

title: In South Korea, Op Sindoor Delegation's Message On "Sponsors" Of Terror
content: An all-party parliamentary delegation sent to S Korea to convey India's response to terrorism in the aftermath of the military campaign Operation Sindoor told Korean dignitaries that "no distinction can be made between terrorists and their sponsors.

title: "Selling Nation To US": Sheikh Hasina's Big Charge Against Muhammad Yunus
content: Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has accused the south asian country's interim government head Muhammad Yunus of "selling the nation to the United States."

title: Protesters Clash With Security Forces Near Manipur Governor's House, 7 Injured
content: At least seven women were injured on Sunday when security forces fired tear gas shells and used mock bombs to disperse protesters marching towards Raj Bhavan in Imphal.

title: Man Kills Mother For Not Cooking Meal For Him In Maharashtra, Arrested: Cops
content: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his mother after she did not wake up to cook a meal for him in Maharashtra's Dhule district, police said on Sunday.

title: Video: Minor Damage At Delhi Airport Terminal 1 After Heavy Overnight Rain
content: Part of the shade at the Terminal 1 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, one of India's busiest, collapsed early Sunday amid heavy thunderstorms and rain, shows a video.

title: "Those Who Abandon Wisdom...": Lalu Yadav's Daughter On Brother Tej Pratap's Expulsion
content: RJD's Rohini Acharya has come out in strong support of her father and party supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's decision to expel his elder son Tej Pratap Yadav from both the party and the family, citing repeated violations of family values.

title: "No Oil Spill So Far": Navy On High Alert After Ship Sank Off Kerala Coast
content: Liberian vessel carrying 640 containers, including 13 with hazardous cargo, sank off the Kochi coast, sparking fears of a possible oil spill. All 24 crew members were rescued after the ship developed a critical tilt, according to officials.

title: Pak's Mass Destruction Weapons Mention In US Threat Report - And China Link
content: the report forecasts that the defence priorities will likely focus on demonstrating global leadership . the reference was to the India-Pakistan conflict earlier in this month . a missile strike provoked multiple rounns in a late April attack .

title: Madrid appoint Alonso as Ancelotti's successor
content: Xabi Alonso has been confirmed as real madrid's new head coach . the 43-year-old will take over from Carlo Ancelotti for this summer's club world cup . he made 236 appearances for the club as a player and began coaching career at the club's academy .

title: 💍 Jaguars' Travis Hunter ties the knot
content: the Jaguars traded up three spots in last month's draft to select Hunter with the no. 2 pick . the couple met at Collins Hill High school in Suwanee, Georgia, and dated throughout Hunter's three-year college career at Jackson State and Colorado .

title: Oilers take control over Stars: Game 3 grades, takeaways
content: Connor McDavid and Zach Hyman each net two goals to power the Oilers to a 2-1 series lead vs. the Stars . losing Game 3 left them trailing a series for the second time this postseason . what does it mean for them to return home tied rather than a game away from elimination?

title: Two-stop experiment doesn't fix F1's Monaco procession problem
content: formula 1's two-stop experiment at the Monaco Grand Prix underlines what the sport already knew about its most famous race . the confines of the circuit are too tight to allow genuine racing . it succeeded in providing a more dynamic race than the previous year, but with just one legal overtake in 78 laps, the fundamental issue with Monaco as an F1 venue was clear to see .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .
